snippet: A Congressman's widow running for her husband's seat captured the attention, but in the end a state senator with an established record appears to have won a special election and advanced to a runoff.    With all precincts in the 42d Congressional ...
lead_paragraph: A Congressman's widow running for her husband's seat captured the attention, but in the end a state senator with an established record appears to have won a special election and advanced to a runoff. With all precincts in the 42d Congressional District reporting, Marta Macias Brown, widow of Representative George E. Brown Jr., trailed a fellow Democrat, State Senator Joe Baca, by 488 votes. But Mrs. Brown refused to concede Tuesday's election -- her first run for office -- citing 1,750 ballots yet to be counted.
abstract: Marta Macias Brown, widow of Rep George E Brown Jr, trails fellow Democrat, State Sen Joe Baca, by 488 votes with all precincts in California's 42d Congressional District reporting in special election for her husband's seat (M)

headline.main: Lawmaker's Widow Apparently Defeated In Bid for His Seat
